I'm Sara, a product design based in Bristol. When I was picking up the main topic, I actually wasn't sure which one to go for. My current problem is that the current way of working cross-functional team is not defined, people are not clear with role and responsibility, I feel very stressed because I have a lots work to do and to improve, meanwhile I have to support my squad and my design team to ensure they are doing their job. On the other hands, I know I need to focus on myself, the portfolio, and my career path but I constantly deprioritise them, which means I feel more stressed about my focus and my ability. Therefore, I just want to talk to someone and understand if that's something common and how you would handle this issues. I'm sorry if that too much to ask.

How you can you advice that person?

It sounds like you're facing a common challenge many people encounter when working on cross-functional teams: unclear roles and responsibilities. This can definitely be stressful and make it difficult to focus on your own work and career development.

One potential solution to this problem is to have a clear and detailed definition of each team member's role and responsibilities. This can be communicated through a team charter or similar document that outlines the goals, objectives, and expectations for each member of the team. This can help to establish clarity and reduce confusion about who is responsible for what.

In addition to having a clear team charter, it can also be helpful to regularly check in with your team members to make sure everyone is on track and has the support they need to successfully fulfill their responsibilities. This can be done through regular meetings or by setting up a system for reporting progress and seeking help when needed.

It's also important to remember to take care of yourself and prioritize your own well-being in the midst of a busy and potentially stressful work environment. This may mean setting aside time for self-care and reflection, seeking support from colleagues or a mentor, or taking steps to manage your stress and maintain a healthy work-life balance.

Overall, the key to managing these challenges is to establish clear communication and collaboration within your team, and to prioritize your own well-being. This can help to reduce stress and ensure that everyone is able to successfully contribute to the team's goals.

Another potential solution to the problem of unclear roles and responsibilities on a cross-functional team is to establish regular, structured communication channels. This can include regular team meetings, individual check-ins with team members, or a designated channel for discussing and coordinating work. By establishing these channels, team members can stay informed about each other's progress and share information, resources, and support as needed.

Additionally, setting clear goals and objectives for the team can also help to establish clarity around roles and responsibilities. By defining what the team is working towards and what success looks like, team members can better understand their own roles and how they fit into the broader picture. This can help to align individual efforts and ensure that everyone is working towards the same goals.

Finally, involving all team members in the process of defining roles and responsibilities can help to ensure that everyone has a clear understanding of their role and how it contributes to the team's success. This can involve holding team-building or planning sessions where roles and responsibilities are discussed and agreed upon, or using other collaborative techniques to ensure that everyone is on the same page.
Could one of the solution can be a better plan for my self, to structures my life?

Yes, developing a plan for yourself can definitely be a helpful solution to managing the challenges you're facing. A personal plan can help you to prioritize your own well-being and career development, and can provide a roadmap for achieving your goals.

To develop a personal plan, you might start by defining your goals and objectives. What do you want to achieve in your career and personal life? What steps do you need to take to get there? By defining these goals and creating a plan to achieve them, you can better focus your efforts and stay on track.

Next, you can identify any obstacles or challenges that may be standing in the way of achieving your goals. What is preventing you from focusing on your own work and career development? What support or resources do you need to overcome these challenges? By identifying and addressing these obstacles, you can create a more realistic and effective plan.

Finally, you can develop strategies for staying on track and achieving your goals. This might include setting aside dedicated time for self-care and reflection, seeking support from colleagues or a mentor, or establishing a system for tracking your progress and staying accountable. By implementing these strategies, you can increase your chances of success and reduce stress and anxiety.

Overall, developing a personal plan can be a powerful tool for managing the challenges you're facing and achieving your goals. By defining your objectives, addressing obstacles, and implementing strategies for success, you can better focus your efforts and stay on track.
